abstract: The iPad is a device for consuming media, not creating it. So are the media providers ready to do business?
snippet: The iPad is a device for consuming media, not creating it. So are the media providers ready to do business?
lead_paragraph: Short of landing in a flying saucer and having a tablet teleported into his hands, there was no way that Steve Jobs could have lived up to the hype before last Wednesday’s iPad announcement.

headline.main: To Deliver, iPad Needs Media Deals
headline.print_headline: To Deliver, iPad Needs Media Deals

abstract: Many video sites have been experimenting with a new format, HTML5, that may reduce an attitude that devices failing to support Adobe’s Flash technology are wanting.
snippet: Many video sites have been experimenting with a new format, HTML5, that may reduce an attitude that devices failing to support Adobe’s Flash technology are wanting.

headline.main: IPad Can’t Play Flash Video, but It May Not Matter
headline.print_headline: IPad Can’t Play Flash Video, but It May Not Matter

abstract: While Apple may not come out and say it has no interest in supporting Adobe’s Flash, its actions speak louder than words.
snippet: While Apple may not come out and say it has no interest in supporting Adobe’s Flash, its actions speak louder than words.
lead_paragraph: Adobe’s Flash will probably not come to the iPhone, iPod Touch or iPad, but for many people with these iProducts, this may prove to be a nonissue, as I report in Monday’s Times.

headline.main: Why the iPad Web Demo Was Full of Holes

abstract: Media Equation: The Apple iPad delivers a glimpse of the future, but are the people and companies who must provide media and applications for the device ready for its arrival?
snippet: Media Equation: The Apple iPad delivers a glimpse of the future, but are the people and companies who must provide media and applications for the device ready for its arrival?
lead_paragraph: In his Media Equation column Monday morning, David Carr takes a look at Apple’s ballyhooed iPad and concludes that its future will be determined by the coming flood of new applications and media deals. But even now, without them, it is clear that the new device is a glimpse over the horizon — “I couldn’t say the future had arrived, but I’m pretty sure you can see if from here,” Mr. Carr writes.

headline.main: Media Equation: iPad is a Bit of a Tabula Rasa Offering a Glimpse of the Future

abstract: With the A4 chip, Apple has challenged the norms of the mobile device industry, where chip design is usually left to microprocessor companies.
snippet: With the A4 chip, Apple has challenged the norms of the mobile device industry, where chip design is usually left to microprocessor companies.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Sure, the screen is nice. But the iPad’s most important component, at least for Apple’s future, may be the A4, the fingernail-size chip at the tablet’s heart.

headline.main: A Little Chip Designed by Apple Itself
headline.print_headline: In the Heart of the iPad, Apple Is Betting on a Microchip of Its Own Design

byline.original: By Ashlee Vance and Brad Stone
